title: The Sweet Corn Cultivation Revolution: Seed to Harvest

subtasks: Prepare the soil (rich in nutrients, good drainage)
Plant seeds at correct depth (1 inch) and spacing (8-12 inches apart)
Protect plants from pests (natural predators, eco-friendly pesticides)
Harvest corn ears when silk turns brown and husk is green
Monitor ear development (kernels swelling, turning yellow)
Time harvest when silk has turned brown, husk green
Handle harvested corn to preserve sweetness (cooling, processing)
Appreciate combination of traditional and modern methods
Consider benefits (higher yields, better quality, sustainability)
